event.doc_name: Memorandum of Law in Support of Joint Motion to Dismiss

evidence.source_document: Investigation of the Hampton Roads Regional Jail (Portsmouth, Virginia)

evidence.text: Iko v. Shreve, 535 F.3d 225, 241 (4th Cir. 2008) (quoting Henderson v. Sheahan, 196 F.3d 839, 846 (7th Cir. 1999)).
evidence.source_document: Investigation of the Hampton Roads Regional Jail (Portsmouth, Virginia)

evidence.text: Turner v. Ruffin, No. 1:16-cv-510, 2017 WL 2405371, at *4 (E.D. Va. June 2, 2017) (“A delay in medical treatment may constitute deliberate indifference” if it results in “substantial harm [such as] lifelong handicap, permanent loss or considerable pain.”);
evidence.source_document: Investigation of the Hampton Roads Regional Jail (Portsmouth, Virginia)

add_extracted.value: Turner v. Ruffin, 2017 WL 2405371 (E.D. Va. June 2, 2017)

evidence.text: The case was settled via consent decree (ECF 5) without trial proceedings; the Jail Authority voted to shut down the facility with no inmates remaining (ECF 76, p. 2).
evidence.source_document: Memorandum of Law in Support of Joint Motion to Dismiss

evidence.text: The parties jointly requested dismissal of the matter (ECF 76) without any mention of appellate proceedings; the case was resolved through consent decree enforcement and subsequent dismissal.
evidence.source_document: Memorandum of Law in Support of Joint Motion to Dismiss
